subject: DSSC
title: Ways of Knowing
info:
Approaches practiced by physical, biological, social science, and humanities scholars. \"Ways of knowing\" in different cultures/groups. Issues/methodological challenges facing interdisciplinary/international studies. Taught by faculty from biological, social sciences, and humanities.

prereq: Grad DSSC minor or instr consent

subject: DSSC
title: Scholarship and Responsibility
info:
Seminar. Concerns/themes relevant to public engagement in academic work. Diverse practices of reading, writing, and pedagogy. Privileged locations of knowledge. Tactics of civil society organizing. Politics of collaborative work.

prereq: Grad DSSC minor or instr consent

subject: DSSC
title: Doctoral Research Workshop
info:
Interdisciplinary workshop to assist doctoral students in writing successful research and grant proposals to support their dissertation research on themes related to global social change. Enables students to develop interdisciplinary peer review and feedback skills and consider ethical and practical issues global south research.   

prereq: Grad DSSC minor or instr consent

subject: DSSC
title: Doctoral Research Workshop
info:
Identification of potential funding sources for field research and the writing of grant proposals.  Preparing for and conducting field research.  Taken during the year before undertaking field research, typically the third year of graduate study.

prereq: Grad DSSC minor or instr consent

subject: DSSC
title: Development Social Change
info: Seven-week to full semester seminar. Topical issues in development and social change.

subject: DSSC
title: Directed Study
info:
Directed study with consent from DGS

prereq: DSSC graduate student
